title: Trump Administration Aims to Strip More Foreign-Born Americans of Citizenship
summary: An official with U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services said it would prioritize “those who’ve unlawfully obtained U.S. citizenship.”

title: ICE Must Allow Lawmakers to Inspect Detention Centers, Judge Rules
summary: Judge Jia M. Cobb wrote that two policies announced in June appeared to unlawfully bar members of Congress from making unannounced visits at immigration detention facilities.

title: ICE Arrests Disrupt Schools, Prompting Fear Among Families
summary: President Trump’s immigration crackdown has at times resulted in arrests near schools, setting off concerns among parents, educators and students.

title: Immigration Agents and Protesters Face Off in Frigid Minnesota
summary: A surge of ICE agents has led to 670 arrests and chaotic standoffs in subzero weather.

title: House Rejects Measure to Bar Strikes Inside Venezuela
summary: The Democratic measure was defeated mostly along party lines, along with another resolution that would have halted the military’s escalating campaign of boat attacks.

title: Top Republican Examining Boat Strike ‘Satisfied’ With Military Mission
summary: After viewing video of a follow-up strike, Republicans largely had confidence in the Pentagon’s legal rationale while Democrats questioned its legality.

title: Dan Bongino to Step Down as FBI Deputy Director
summary: The departure of Mr. Bongino had seemed inevitable since August, when the White House hired Missouri’s attorney general, Andrew Bailey, to share his job as deputy director.

title: Republicans Clinch Democrats’ Bid to Force Vote on ACA Subsidies
summary: After the speaker denied them a vote on extending the subsidies, four Republicans from competitive districts joined Democrats’ bid to go around G.O.P. leaders and force action.

title: Fani Willis Calls Trump and Allies ‘Criminals’ in Hearing Before Georgia Senate Committee
summary: The district attorney in Atlanta addressed a Republican-led committee created to investigate her conduct during her prosecution of President Trump last year.

title: Jack Smith Defends Trump Prosecutions in House Deposition
summary: Even adversaries of Jack Smith, the former special counsel, conceded that his tight-lipped, painstaking approach made tripping him up particularly difficult.

title: Bodies of Rob and Michele Reiner Were Found in Master Bedroom, Police Say
summary: After finding the slain couple, investigators focused on their younger son, Nick, as a suspect. He was formally charged with murder on Tuesday.

title: Video Footage Shows Nick Reiner Enter Store an Hour Before His Arrest
summary: Mr. Reiner was filmed entering a gas station’s store in South Los Angeles to buy a sports drink roughly an hour before he was arrested by the police across the street.

title: How the Rhinelander Trial Scandalized the Jazz Age
summary: Rhinelander v. Rhinelander was one of the most scandalous trials of the Jazz Age. 100 years later, it reads as a tragedy about the country’s original sin.

title: N.Y. Governor Will Sign Right-to-Die Bill for the Terminally Ill
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul cast the measure in unusually personal terms, saying she had felt “the pain of seeing someone you love suffer and feeling powerless to stop it.”

title: Search for Unidentified Killer at Brown University Stretches to 4th Day
summary: Officials said that they were working with physical evidence, including DNA, and that they were seeking a second man who appeared to have crossed paths with the possible suspect’.

title: Twelve Men Saturated East Harlem Housing Project With Drugs, U.S. Says
summary: For more than three and a half years, officials said, the men used the Johnson Houses as “an open drug market” to sell crack cocaine and fentanyl.

title: Fighting for Femininity, Not Feminism on the New Women’s Right
summary: A group of young conservatives feel that the pressures they face as 20-something women have been made worse by the liberal feminism that defined their youth.

title: The New Flu Variant Could Spread Widely This Year. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Here’s what to know about the dominant version of the virus that’s circulating now.

title: Canada’s Population Shrinks Amid Tightened Immigration
summary: The government has greatly restricted the number of work and study permits issued to foreigners following an unpopular immigration boom during the pandemic.

title: Beloved Objects Cherished By Those We Lost in 2025
summary: Metal crosses, a recliner, a blue wedding suit: the most cherished belongings of Ozzy Osbourne, Brian Wilson, Kitty Dukakis and others.

title: Let’s Go Beyond Trump’s Vile Words About Rob Reiner
summary: We must do far more to address the national crisis of addiction that leaves so many households in despair as well as danger.

title: The Man Who Rules the Country Presides Over Nothing
summary: Why are the Supreme Court and Congress conspiring to give him more power?

title: The U.S. Seeks to Increase Denaturalizations
summary: Also, New York will allow the terminally ill to end their lives. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: How Do You Afford Life in New York City?
summary: The New York Times is looking to talk to New Yorkers about how they budget, splurge and save in one of the most expensive cities in the world.

title: California’s Endless Fog Is Finally Clearing
summary: An unrelenting gloom has blanketed much of the state’s Central Valley since late November.

title: Christine Choy, Documentarian of Asian American Life, Dies at 76
summary: Her film “Who Killed Vincent Chin?” earned an Oscar nomination in 1988 and was inducted into the National Film Registry for its cultural significance.

title: Stabbing Near Chabad Headquarters Investigated as a Possible Hate Crime
summary: A dispute on a Brooklyn street appeared to explode after the perpetrator made antisemitic statements, the police said.
